#summary Ruby bindings

= Introduction =

The Ruby bindings for the WebDriver API are available as the [http://rubygems.org/gems/selenium-webdriver selenium-webdriver] gem. 

The bindings support Ruby 1.8.6 through 1.9.1 + JRuby.  

  * [http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/rb/index.html API docs]
  * [http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/common/src/rb/CHANGES Changelog]

= Details =

The bindings provide a slightly rubified version of the WebDriver API:

{{{
require "selenium-webdriver"

driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :firefox
driver.navigate.to "http://google.com"

element = driver.find_element(:name, 'q')
element.send_keys "Hello WebDriver!"
element.submit

puts driver.title

driver.quit
}}}

The ruby bindings have drivers for Firefox, IE, Chrome and the remote server.

The `WebDriver.for()` call is a shortcut for 

{{{
Selenium::WebDriver::Driver.new(Selenium::WebDriver::Firefox::Bridge.new)
}}}

Any extra arguments pass to `for()` (besides the driver symbol) will be passed to the Bridge's constructor. So to configure the remote driver:

{{{
include Selenium

driver = WebDriver.for(:remote, :url                  =>  "http://localhost:4444/wd/hub"
                                :desired_capabilities => WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.firefox)
}}}
